titleStmt.title: Private-men no pulpit-men: or, A modest examination of lay-mens preaching. Discovering it to be neither warranted by the Word of God; nor allowed by the judgement, or practise, of the Churches of Christ in New-England. / Written by Giles Workman, M.A. and master of the Colledge School in Gloucester. In answer to a writing published by John Knowls.
titleStmt.author: Workman, Giles, 1604 or 5-1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by F: Neile for Tho: Vnderhill at the Bible in Woodstreet.,

notesStmt.note: On leaf A2r of "To the reader" Workman states that in 1641 he replied to an anonymous work "justifying the practise of Lay-mens preaching." In 1644 John Knowles "owned and subscribed" the anonymous work. Neither Knowles' work nor Workman's (also presumably anonymous) work have been identified.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
